ranked_diseases.disease_name: Multiple self-healing squamous epithelioma, Ferguson-Smith type
ranked_diseases.explanation: This autosomal dominant condition is characterized by recurrent self-healing squamous epitheliomas, making it the most specific match for the presented phenotype.
Keratoacanthomas are self-healing squamous proliferations that can occur as isolated lesions or in familial patterns, closely matching the phenotype.
This Lynch syndrome variant can present with keratoacanthomas (self-healing squamous epitheliomas) along with sebaceous neoplasms.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Gorlin syndrome (Nevoid basal cell carcinoma syndrome)
ranked_diseases.explanation: While primarily associated with basal cell carcinomas, some patients develop keratoacanthoma-like lesions that can be self-healing.
XP patients can develop various skin tumors including squamous cell carcinomas and keratoacanthomas, though self-healing is less typical.
